title: Question about @develop processing in spack
body:
I'm wondering if spack has a bug related to "develop" version processing or if I am attempting something that is not supported.  I'm trying to build a development version of one of our components, cbtf-krell.  Inside the cbtf-krell package.py file, I have a 
```depends_on(dyninst@9.3.2:", when='@develop')```
statement.    In my build area, I have a version of dyninst/package.py that has a develop version per #8181.

Should line 103 force the build of the dyninst development version?

```
   100	    depends_on("boost@1.66.0", when='@1.9.1.0:')
   101	
   102	    # For Dyninst
   103	    depends_on("dyninst@9.3.2:", when='@develop')
   104	    depends_on("dyninst@9.3.2", when='@1.9.1.0:')
   105	
   106	    # For MRNet
   107	    depends_on("mrnet@5.0.1-3:+cti", when='@develop+cti')
   108	    depends_on("mrnet@5.0.1-3:+lwthreads", when='@develop')
```
When I try to build cbtf-krell@develop, spack wants to build dyninst-9.3.2.  See below:
Am I misunderstanding how the special spack develop processing works.   

```
spack install cbtf-krell@develop
==> libsigsegv is already installed in /home/jeg/newiest_spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora27-x86_64/gcc-7.2.1/libsigsegv-2.11-7umxuxln3xov2fac2fhoh7ru552h4whz
....
....
==> libdwarf is already installed in /home/jeg/newiest_spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora27-x86_64/gcc-7.2.1/libdwarf-20160507-eg2yfdpazp63rep4h6n5tlgwxogp3bqc
==> Installing dyninst
==> Using cached archive: /home/jeg/newiest_spack/spack/var/spack/cache/dyninst/dyninst-9.3.2.tar.gz
==> Warning: Fetching from mirror without a checksum!
  This package is normally checked out from a version control system, but it has been archived on a spack mirror.  This means we cannot know a checksum for the tarball in advance. Be sure that your connection to this mirror is secure!
==> Staging archive: /home/jeg/newiest_spack/spack/var/spack/stage/dyninst-9.3.2-3ab6oekd5wc6r6zr5efkrthb66yxiopa/dyninst-9.3.2.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /home/jeg/newiest_spack/spack/var/spack/stage/dyninst-9.3.2-3ab6oekd5wc6r6zr5efkrthb66yxiopa
==> No patches needed for dyninst
```
If I add another statement to explicitly force the build of the development version of dyninst:
```depends_on("dyninst@develop", when='@develop')```
and try to build I get this:
```
[jeg@localhost packages]$ spack install cbtf-krell@develop
==> Error: Conflicting conditional dependencies on package cbtf-krell for spec cbtf-krell@develop ^bzip2 ^cmake@3.11.1 ^llvm-openmp-ompt@tr6_forwards+standalone ^ncurses ^ninja@1.5: ^openssl ^pkgconfig ^python ^readline ^sqlite ^zlib
```
